org.mitre.provenance.dag

Class TraversalSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.dag.TraversalSettings

  • public class TraversalSettings
extends Object
    Controls the settings that the graph traverser uses to determine what to return in response to a given query.

    This object provides relatively fine-grained control over what kind of provenance graph to discover from the database.

    Creating default instances of this object will traverse the graph in both directions.

    Specific objects can be created idiomatically by using the chaining methods specified below, such as: 

    new TraversalSettings().onlyForward().setMaxDepth(1).excludeEdges().includeNodes();

    For example, that will create a TraversalSettings object that instructs the code to fetch all nodes forward of a starting point, only one hop away, returning a set of nodes but not edges.

    Author:
    DMALLEN
